Curvature¶

Curvature of the point cloud is computed by surficial curvature.

Curvature Property¶

Attributes

Points Holds the points dataset
Raster Holds raster dataset
Shape_Index
Size Return the size of the property
curvadness Curvadness property defined by
gaussian_curvature Gaussian curvature
k1 Maximal principal curvature value
k2 Minimal principal curvature value
mean Mean curvature values
path The path of the dataset

Methods

enable_pickle() Make the property pickable by transforming the point cloud to PointSet
getPointCurvature(idx) Retrieve the curvature object of a specific point
getValues()
return:min and max curvature
load([principal_curvatures]) Sets curvature into Curvature Property object
normalize_values(bool) A flag whether to normalize values of principal curvature (k1, k2) to [0,1] with 2 being the invalid value
setPointCurvature(idx, values) Sets a curvature object to specific points
set_invalid_value(value) Value for curvature that was not computed
similarity_curvature() Calculate similarity curvature (E,H)

Methods documentation

class CurvatureProperty.CurvatureProperty(points, principal_curvatures=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Curvature property initially holds only the principal curvatures. However if an additional type of curvature is transferred in “kwargs” it will be assigned, with its name (as sent by kwargs) and an additional dictionary.

Shape_Index¶
curvadness¶

Curvadness property defined by

\[\kappa_{curvadness}=\sqrt{\frac{\lambda_\max ^2 + \lambda_\min ^2}{2}}\]
enable_pickle()[source]¶

Make the property pickable by transforming the point cloud to PointSet

Note

the object is not pickable when the points are Open3DPointSet

Returns:
gaussian_curvature¶

Gaussian curvature

Computed by

\[\kappa_{Gaussian}=\lambda_{\max} \cdot \lambda_{\min}\]

Parameters:

  • values (k1 and k2) – the curvature objects to assign

similarity_curvature()[source]¶

Calculate similarity curvature (E,H)

According to [RK06].

Parameters:k1,k2 – principal curvatures (k1>k2)
Returns:rgb: RGB color for every point, values of similarity curvature (E,H)

class CurvatureFactory.CurvatureFactory[source]¶

curvature parameters computation

classmethod checkNeighborhood(neighborhood, min_points_in_neighborhood=5, min_points_in_sector=2, valid_sectors=7, num_sectors=4)[source]¶

Check if a neighborhood is viable for curvature computation.

Decided according to number of neighbors and distribution of the points around the reference points. The second condition is defined by the number of sectors with a minimum number of points.

Parameters:
  • neighborhood (PointNeighborhood.PointNeighborhood) – all points that compose the neighborhood of index 0 point
  • min_points_in_neighborhood (int) – minimal number of points in a neighborhood to make it viable for curvature computation. Default: 5
  • min_points_in_sector (int) – minimal points in a sector to be considered valid. Default: 2
  • valid_sectors (int) – minimal sectors needed for a point to be considered good. Default: 7
  • num_sectors (int) – the number of sectors the circle is divided to
Returns:

true if the neighborhood is valid; false otherwise
Return type:

bool
classmethod curvature_by_3parameters(neighborhood, normal)[source]¶

Curvature computation based on fundamental form when fitting bi-quadratic surface.

Parameters:
  • neighborhood (PointNeighborhood.PointNeighbohhod, np.ndarray, PointSet.PointSet) – the neighbors according to which the curvature is computed
  • normal (np.array) – normal to the point which the curvature is computed
Returns:

minimal and maximal curvature
Return type:

tuple

Algorithm

  1. Rotate so that the normal will be [0 0 1]

    the bi-quadratic surface coefficients \(d,e,f\) are zero and the fitting is of three parameters:

    \[z(x,y) = ax^2 + by^2 + cxy\]

  2. Second derivatives dictate the curvature

    \[\begin{split}{\bf H} = \begin{bmatrix} 2a & c \\ c & 2b \end{bmatrix}\end{split}\]

  3. The principal curvatures are computed as:

    \[C=\sqrt{c^2+\left[\left(a-b\right)\right]^2}\]
    \[\kappa_{1,2} = \frac{a+b}{2}\pm C\]
classmethod curvature_numeric(raster, ksize=3, sigma=2.5, gradientType='L1')[source]¶

Compute raster curvature based on first fundamental form

Parameters:
  • raster (np.array or RasterData) – the raster image
  • ksize – window/kernel size (equivalent to neighborhood size)
  • sigma (float) – for Gaussian blurring
  • gradientType (str) – ‘L1’ or ‘L2’ for derivatives computation
Returns:

curvature map
Return type:

curvatureProperty
classmethod curvature_with_CUDA(neighborProperty, normals)[source]¶

Compute normals of each point using CUDA

Parameters:
  • neighborProperty (NeighborProperty) – neighborProperty to compute normal for each of its points
  • normals (np.array (3xn,)) – normals shape (3*n,) while n is the number of normals
Returns:

curvature as 1 dim numpy array

    curvatures = CurvatureFactory.umbrella_curvature(neiProp, normals1, valid_sectors=4, invalid_value=0,
                                                     verbose=True)
classmethod filter_curvature_roughness(curvature_property, attribute_name, mean=0, std=1, alpha=0.05, verbose=False, posonly=False)[source]¶

Turns curvature values to zero if they are part of a normal distribution N~(mean, std)

\[H_0:\qquad \left|\kappa \right| \leq Z_{1-\frac{\alpha}{2}}\]
Parameters:
  • curvature_property (CurvatureProperty) – the curvature property to which the filterization is applied
  • attribute_name (str) – the curvature attribute to filter
  • mean (float) – the mean value which will turn to zero if a value is part of the population. Default: 0
  • std (float) – the standard deviation from the mean value. Usually defined by the data texture/roughness. Defualt: 1
  • alpha (float) – the confidence level according to which a value is measured
  • verbose (bool) – print inter-running messages
Returns:

a new curvature property with filterized values. All values that were in the old property are kept.
Return type:

CurvatureProperty
classmethod pointSetOpen3D_3parameters(neighbors_property, normals_property=None, min_points_in_neighborhood=5, min_points_in_sector=2, valid_sectors=7, num_sectors=8, invalid_value=-999, verbose=False)[source]¶

Curvature of a PointSetOpen3D with its normals and neighborhood via the three-parameters algorithm.

Warning

If a pointset3D is sent without its normals computed in advance, the normals will be computed according to the first point neighborhood parameters

Parameters:
  • neighbors_property (NeighborsProperty.NeighborsProperty) – the neighbors property of the point cloud
  • normals_property (NormalsProperty.NormalsProperty) – normals computed for the point cloud in advance
  • min_points_in_neighborhood (int) – minimal number of points in a neighborhood to make it viable for curvature computation. Default: 5
  • min_points_in_sector (int) – minimal points in a sector to be considered valid. Default: 2
  • valid_sectors (int) – minimal sectors needed for a point to be considered good. Default: 7
  • num_sectors (int) – the number of sectors the circle is divided to. Default: 8
  • invalid_value (float) – value for invalid curvature (points that their curvature cannot be computed). Default: -999
  • verbose (bool) – print inter running messages. default: False
Returns:

curvature property
Return type:

CurvatureProperty

See also

curvature_by_3parameters()

classmethod tensorProperty_3parameters(tensorProperty, min_points=5)[source]¶

Compute curvature for tensors, via the three-parameters algorithm.

Curvature for tensors that have less points than min_points will not be computed.

Parameters:
  • tensorProperty (TensorProperty.TensorProperty) – the tensors of the points cloud (precomputed)
  • min_points – minimum points required to compute curvature for a point
Returns:

Curvature property
Return type:

CurvatureProperty

See also

curvature_by_3parameters()

classmethod umbrella_curvature(neighbrohood, normals, min_obj_size=0.01, alpha=0.05, min_points_in_neighborhood=5, min_points_in_sector=2, valid_sectors=7, num_sectors=8, invalid_value=-999, curvatureProperty=None, verbose=False)[source]¶

Compute an umbrella curvature,

Defined in [FK14]

Based on the idea that the size of the curvature (openness) is influenced by the projection of the neighboring points on the normal vector.

\[\kappa_{um} = \sum_{i=1}^m \left| \frac{N_i-p}{\left|N_i-p\right|}\cdot \bf{n}\right|\]

with \(N_i\) the neighbor i of point \(p\), and \(\bf{n}\) the normal at point \(p\).

Note

Each projection is checked so it will not be statistically zero in confidence level of \(\alpha\).

Parameters:
  • neighbrohood (NeighborsProperty.NeighborsProperty) – neighborhood property of a point cloud
  • normals (NormalsProperty.NormalsProperty) – normals property of a point cloud
  • min_obj_size (float) – minimal object size - usually refers to surface roughness
  • alpha (float) – confidence value for statistical test
  • min_points_in_neighborhood (int) – minimal number of points in a neighborhood to make it viable for curvature computation. Default: 8
  • min_points_in_sector (int) – minimal points in a sector to be considered valid. Default: 1
  • valid_sectors (int) – minimal sectors needed for a point to be considered good. Default: 7
  • num_sectors (int) – the number of sectors the circle is divided to. Default: 8
  • invalid_value (float) – value for invalid curvature (points that their curvature cannot be computed). Default: -999
  • curvatureProperty (CurvatureProperty) – A curvature property to update with the umbrella curvature. If None, a new curvature property will be created, with the principal curvatures as None.
  • verbose (bool) – print inter running messages. default: False
Returns:

umbrella curvature for all points that have enough neighbors for the curvature to be computed.
Return type:

np.array

See also

__good_point() and __checkNeighborhood()
